meaning: convert a normal character into a metacharacter
example: `"\\s"` matches any whitespace character (tabs, newlines and spaces); `"\\S"` matches any non-whitespace characters; `"\\d"` matches any digit; `"\\D"` matches any non-digit character; `"\\w"` matches any word character (uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits and underscore); `"\\W"` matches any non-word characters (note that we need to double-up the backslash in R, other languages use a single backslash in these contexts)

meaning: convert a metacharacter into a normal (literal) character
example: `"\\."` matches with a literal period; `"\\("` matches with a literal left parenthesis
